transformed_texts:
I think the Catholic Church needs to change some things.
Many people leave because the Church does not accept many things. These include same-sex marriage, abortion, and birth control.
The Church has strong views. But some of these views are old. They should change to a newer style.
People are leaving the Church because they do not agree with these views.
I think women could be priests and priests could be married.
I do not know if these changes would make people stay.
But I think priests should have a family life like other people.

I like people. I do not mind if they are gay. Why should they be blamed for their feelings? I think everyone has a right to love who they want. It is not a choice they make. I am not against gay marriage. I think it is wrong to say that a man and a woman can marry, but two people of the same sex cannot. I do not think the government should be involved in this. It is not about security or morals. They should not tell people how to live their lives. People are born that way. They should not be punished for it. I believe in freedom.

I believe that gay marriage should be legal. Many people think that gay couples threaten traditional families. However, gay relationships are different than straight relationships. They are not the same, like two sides of a coin: heads and tails. Many people have different opinions about morality and religion. Legalizing gay marriage does not mean gay couples want to get married in a church. They just want a legal document, like a marriage certificate. This does not involve church and state. Some people say that gay couples cannot adopt children or that they will harm society. However, scientific studies show that gay couples have the same success rates as straight couples. Other people think that gay couples will cause problems in communities or that their children will be harmed. However, studies show that children of gay parents do well in society. The federal government should make gay marriage legal in every state. President Bush has strong views about gay marriage, similar to his views on abortion and stem cell research. Most reasons against gay marriage are based on religion. However, what is right morally can differ from person to person. It is unethical to ignore the moral beliefs of other groups while supporting laws based on religious beliefs. Many people believe that gay people are psychologically damaged. However, the American Psychological Association says this is not true. People should listen to experts and studies, not just popular opinions.

I work at a hospital pharmacy over the summer.
Just because a drug is illegal does not mean it is good for people.
I would not give it to the public.
But for medical use, yes.
Many illegal drugs are good. Like oxycodone, Vicodin, Percocet.
These are called controlled substances.
We use them because they help people. If you say no to marijuana because it is illegal, you should not.
You should think about the good things it does.
It is not like alcohol. If you do not abuse it, it is not harmful.
I think it should become legal gradually, not all at once, because then people will abuse it.
First, we must change how people think about marijuana.
If we do that, people will use it responsibly.
They can use it for medical reasons too.

I think the church has changed for the 21st century.
It is less strict than before.
When I was young, I went to church every Sunday.
I wore cute dresses, matching shoes, and a purse.
I went to a private school and saw friends there on weekends.
Now, the church has a special mass for teens.
It is 30 minutes long and people dress casually.
During summer, some people come straight from the beach.
There are late families too.
So, the church is more casual.
Even at morning masses, people wear jeans and khakis.
The church politics and priest marries are not clear.
I do not think they could have prevented the pedophile accusations.
Some men who are married still become pedophiles.
I think it is genetics, not their choice.
Marriage does not change this.
Some religions allow priests to marry, like Seventh Heaven.
If they want to marry, they might change religions.
The church could not stop pedophiles if they did not know.
Shame on them if they covered it up.

I was okay with starting the Iraq war, but I think we went in under a false reason. Many people believe that the Bush administration used the September 11th attacks and Osama Bin Laden as a reason to go to war with Iraq. They said Saddam Hussein had weapons of mass destruction, but that was not true.

I think the Bush administration lied to the American people. Even Colin Powell, who presented evidence at the UN, now says he did not believe it. I think that is a serious crime. It is like the Bush administration did not care about the constitution. They wanted to go to war.

I think the younger Bush wanted to go to war because his father's administration had problems with Saddam Hussein. He also wanted to get more oil. This is not a good way to start a war.

I think the war has gone on too long. If we leave now, the country might have civil war. Many people will die. The UN and the United States are now trying to get other countries from around Iraq to help. But this might cause more problems. Iraq's independence could be a big issue. The government is not working well. The Prime Minister cannot control the political process. There are many radical groups fighting for power. The political process is very difficult.

I cannot say more about this in polite company.

At this time, I speak about the War in Iraq.
I think it not good because not declared war.
I think it started because we think Iraq do bad things, like nine-eleven.
I no big fan of this war.
I not follow much details.
I think we stay there to help them have democracy.
I think also want oil.
But this no good for many reasons.
We try to change Iraq too much, like make it like U.S.
This no good for Iraq people.
War make Iraq worse and make people angry.
We not say good things about this president.
I think this war like Vietnam and will last forever.
I feel bad for soldiers' families.
But Iraq people and America people different.
If we stay, war will get worse.
Al-Qaeda will grow and hate for U.S. will grow.
I think this war will last many years.
This is end of my thoughts.

I do not feel it is right for the government to make it legal. It is up to the churches to decide. The constitution says separation of church and state. It is already written in stone. I think it is wrong for the government to decide what the churches can and cannot make illegal. Most Catholics and Christians do not support it. It is not up to the government to decide what the churches are allowed to do. Separation of church and state is a key part of the constitution. It is up to the churches to decide this, not the president or any government. There is no reason to make it illegal. It could even be good for society.

I said everything I wanted to say.

I was not happy when the government in my country started a war in Iraq. I thought they did not tell us the real reasons for the war. Many people thought it was related to the attacks of September 11th. But really, the two events did not have much connection. The government made it seem like there was a big danger from Iraq. It wanted us to feel angry about the attacks and support the war. The war started in 2003.

I am against war, especially a preemptive strike. I think we should not get into war. But if we do, we need to plan for all possible outcomes. The government should have been more prepared for the war. Many American soldiers died. The government should have thought about what would happen after removing Iraq's government. The country became unstable and chaotic. The US tried to build a new government, but it was a long and hard process. This was similar to what happened in Vietnam. Many people in Iraq did not support the US. The government did not prepare for the many people who did not want change. Many American soldiers are still dying today. The government is trying to train Iraqi soldiers and police. But it is taking a long time. The government made it seem like the war would be short and successful. But it is not easy to build a new government. It takes time and effort. I think the government did not tell us the truth about the war. The war is still going on today.

I was not sure who to vote for in the 2004 election. I might have voted for George Bush to finish what he started. It is hard to leave Iraq after being there for so long. We took away their government and way of life. But we should also think about the many American soldiers who died. We need to decide if it is worth the risk for a free democratic Iraq. The main reason for the war was oil. We get oil from Iraq. But we did not attack other countries with weapons of mass destruction. I hope the war ends soon, but I do not think it will.

I am for gay marriage. I always have been. I think it is a personal choice, not something that should be controlled by others. I think it is inhumane to take away rights from someone because of something they cannot control. I have been an advocate for gay marriage.

I do not think politics or government should be involved in personal choices. It is a household matter, not a national one. In my neighborhood, there are openly gay couples who live and function like any other family. They walk their dogs and act like any other family.

I think it is ridiculous for politicians to interpret the meaning of marriage. Marriage should be a private choice, not a public issue.

I have read and heard from many sources that being gay might be a biological issue. It could be something you are predisposed to, not something learned from your upbringing.

I think it is strange that marriage between a man and a woman is a private matter, but marriage between two people of the same sex is public news. Marriage should be a private choice, not a public debate.

I do not think it is right for politicians to interfere with personal choices. It is a private matter between two people.

Internet is public, everyone can see.
Putting things online can affect how people think.
If you say bad things, like wanting to hurt others, people will worry.
School must act on these warnings.
School cannot ignore serious threats.
People sometimes joke, but it can be hard to know.
School must check internet accounts.
If something is dangerous, school must act.
School should not follow students online.
School should not make fake accounts to watch students.
Students should not post dangerous things online.
School should not see private things.
School should trust students, but must check when needed.
If something is serious, school must act quickly.

I think the war has gone on too long.
The purpose was good at first.
It was to give democracy to a country.
But now, I think we have lost the reason.
Maybe we are fighting just to show that we are a powerful country.
I think the original reason was not fair.
It involved George Bush’s father and Saddam Hussein.
The purpose of giving democracy to a country is good.
But I think our reason changed and now it is unclear.
We should have ended the war after a few months.
We started the war, and that was enough.
But it went on for years.
The government can now handle their own problems.
They do not need our help anymore.
We spend too much money on this war.
We should use this money to help our own country.
We have many problems here like poverty and schools.
We should not spend money on a long-term war.
We should end the war and use the money to fix our own problems.

I ask question about privacy. Some person found information online. This information helped prevent bad situation.

Other person said this is not invasion of privacy. If put information online, many people can see it. Myspace lets friends see profiles. If accept friend, they get permission to see.

But, it's too difficult for one person to check everyone's profiles. It could be unfair to students. But, if someone finds bad information, this is helpful.

I have Facebook. It makes me worry about people who can see my information. This can be dangerous.

I don't know if school should ban Myspace. It's like telling students what they can't do.

I have to talk about the Iraq War two more times. I feel bad talking about it. I hate to say what everyone else says. I hate to join the people who say, "I was against it from the beginning." I was, but it doesn't matter now. The general idea is that it was a bad idea. Only the administration thinks it was a good idea. Everyone else does not. Eighty percent of people in the world think it was a bad idea. Eighty percent of Iraqis think it was a bad idea. Seventy percent of U.S. troops think it was a bad idea and should leave within the year. It has been a disaster. It started before we went in. Pulling out will be a disaster too. The Middle East is very different from the U.S. You can't just bring democracy to an area where people don't want it. Saddam was bad, but we have to consider the pros and cons. It's like quicksand. I don't know what to say. I don't see a reason to stay. The administration thinks there are good reasons to stay, but I don't agree. If we leave now, we can ask the Iraqis if we should leave. If they say yes, it's not our fault if something happens. If we help later, we can be the good guys. We will never be good guys in the Middle East, but it will be better than staying now.

I think gender discrimination is still a problem in the United States. It affects not only women but also men in different fields. For example, in many jobs, people have a hard time working under a woman because society expects men to be in charge. Women often have the skills to get a job but may not be promoted because of this. Men who stay at home to raise children may face criticism. Society often expects men to be the main money-maker. In the fashion industry, men may not be taken seriously if they are interested in fashion. People might think, "How can a man understand fashion?" Because they think men usually have different styles of life. In different jobs, discrimination can also happen based on where you grew up. For example, if you grew up on a farm and have poor grammar, some people might not take you seriously. I think we are making progress, but it takes time for society to change. We should keep working at a steady pace.

They did not make it legal.
They changed it from a crime to a traffic ticket.
This means, if someone gets caught with it, they get a ticket instead of being arrested.
And this could cause problems for jobs and other things.
But it also costs a lot to arrest and lock up people.
So, some places may legalize it to save money.
In Denver, they did this.
Now they have more money for schools, programs for old people, and food for homeless people.
But people should not smoke it in public.
It is still bad in some places and people do not like it.
Also, alcohol is worse for driving than marijuana.
Both have bad effects, but it depends on the person.
Some people can handle it, and some cannot.
It is hard to know how people will react.
But it should not be everywhere because it is still bad in many places.

I agree.
Many traditions are good.
But, we must also change with time.
Many Catholics go to church every week.
They follow rules very closely.
But, sometimes they do not accept others.
This is not fair.
My parents were from different religions.
The church would not marry them.
This is not good.
The church teaches to love others.
But, they do not accept people of other religions.
This is hypocritical.
I think priests should be allowed to marry.
But, I do not think this will stop bad behavior.
Pedophiles will do bad things, whether they are married or not.
I do not think allowing priests to marry will stop this.

I have not decided about this topic yet.
I cannot say which side is right or wrong. This is the most difficult issue we face today.
The separation of church and state is close. Defining marriage is also difficult.
Marriage is also a sacrament. People do not get tax breaks or special treatment if they are baptized.
So, I think marriage should be a civil union. This is what it is.
Two people are united together. Government should not care about the type of marriage.
They should not ask about religion.
Gay marriage is a civil union.
All states should agree to this. Then they can make it federal law.
A constitutional amendment to ban gay marriage is silly. The constitution should not be changed for this.
This is not big enough to change the constitution.
It is not important enough to amend the constitution to define or ban gay marriage.
Simply, no.

I was raised in a Christian home. Homosexuality is a grey area for me because I have many gay friends. I do not agree with that lifestyle. However, I think it should be legal. It should be a decision made by each state, not the president. Many states are democratic and many are republican. Democratic states will support gay marriage. If you live in a democratic state, you know how it feels about this issue. Each state should decide on gay marriage. I think homosexuals should have the same opportunities as heterosexuals. I disagree with Bush's ban on gay marriage. He should not decide this for the whole country. He should not decide how each state wants to run itself. I think some things should be left up to each state. Plus, he will be out of office in a few years. If a democratic president wants to lift the ban, it will just go back and forth. It should be up to each state because they will live with the decision. I do not agree with Bush's decision.

Myspace is a public place. People post there for others to see. If something is posted on the internet, school officials can see it. This is okay because it helps them keep students safe.

If school officials use Myspace to catch students in trouble, that is an invasion of privacy. But, if they do this to make the school safer, it is fine. For example, they might look for students who post about drinking or smoking. This helps keep students safe.

I am worried about posting things online. I am afraid something bad will happen later in life. For example, I might write a bad email about someone and it might come back to haunt me.

Schools must keep students safe. They do this by practicing for emergencies like terrorist attacks. They also use Myspace to help keep students safe. This is what school officials were doing in this case. They were making the school safer.

I was very angry after nine eleven.
I wanted to go to Iraq and fight there.
I thought we could cause as much trouble as they had caused in America.
Now, I think this was not a good idea.
We were not prepared.
We did not have a plan.
I think it did not help our situation.
I do not think people in Iraq are good.
They fight a lot.
They cannot work together.
I do not think we should stay there.
We should leave.
I think we went there because we were very angry.
Now I think we should leave.
We cannot change people there.
We should not try to make them better.
I think we should just leave.
We are not helping there.
We are just hurting ourselves.

I think the Catholic Church needs to change some things.
Many people leave because the Church does not accept many things. These include same-sex marriage, abortion, and birth control.
The Church has strong views. But some of these views are old. They should change to a newer style.
People are leaving the Church because they do not agree with these views.
I think women could be priests and priests could be married.
I do not know if these changes would make people stay.
But I think priests should have a family life like other people.

I like people. I do not mind if they are gay. Why should they be blamed for their feelings? I think everyone has a right to love who they want. It is not a choice they make. I am not against gay marriage. I think it is wrong to say that a man and a woman can marry, but two people of the same sex cannot. I do not think the government should be involved in this. It is not about security or morals. They should not tell people how to live their lives. People are born that way. They should not be punished for it. I believe in freedom.

I believe that gay marriage should be legal. Many people think that gay couples threaten traditional families. However, gay relationships are different than straight relationships. They are not the same, like two sides of a coin: heads and tails. Many people have different opinions about morality and religion. Legalizing gay marriage does not mean gay couples want to get married in a church. They just want a legal document, like a marriage certificate. This does not involve church and state. Some people say that gay couples cannot adopt children or that they will harm society. However, scientific studies show that gay couples have the same success rates as straight couples. Other people think that gay couples will cause problems in communities or that their children will be harmed. However, studies show that children of gay parents do well in society. The federal government should make gay marriage legal in every state. President Bush has strong views about gay marriage, similar to his views on abortion and stem cell research. Most reasons against gay marriage are based on religion. However, what is right morally can differ from person to person. It is unethical to ignore the moral beliefs of other groups while supporting laws based on religious beliefs. Many people believe that gay people are psychologically damaged. However, the American Psychological Association says this is not true. People should listen to experts and studies, not just popular opinions.

I work at a hospital pharmacy over the summer.
Just because a drug is illegal does not mean it is good for people.
I would not give it to the public.
But for medical use, yes.
Many illegal drugs are good. Like oxycodone, Vicodin, Percocet.
These are called controlled substances.
We use them because they help people. If you say no to marijuana because it is illegal, you should not.
You should think about the good things it does.
It is not like alcohol. If you do not abuse it, it is not harmful.
I think it should become legal gradually, not all at once, because then people will abuse it.
First, we must change how people think about marijuana.
If we do that, people will use it responsibly.
They can use it for medical reasons too.

I think the church has changed for the 21st century.
It is less strict than before.
When I was young, I went to church every Sunday.
I wore cute dresses, matching shoes, and a purse.
I went to a private school and saw friends there on weekends.
Now, the church has a special mass for teens.
It is 30 minutes long and people dress casually.
During summer, some people come straight from the beach.
There are late families too.
So, the church is more casual.
Even at morning masses, people wear jeans and khakis.
The church politics and priest marries are not clear.
I do not think they could have prevented the pedophile accusations.
Some men who are married still become pedophiles.
I think it is genetics, not their choice.
Marriage does not change this.
Some religions allow priests to marry, like Seventh Heaven.
If they want to marry, they might change religions.
The church could not stop pedophiles if they did not know.
Shame on them if they covered it up.

I was okay with starting the Iraq war, but I think we went in under a false reason. Many people believe that the Bush administration used the September 11th attacks and Osama Bin Laden as a reason to go to war with Iraq. They said Saddam Hussein had weapons of mass destruction, but that was not true.

I think the Bush administration lied to the American people. Even Colin Powell, who presented evidence at the UN, now says he did not believe it. I think that is a serious crime. It is like the Bush administration did not care about the constitution. They wanted to go to war.

I think the younger Bush wanted to go to war because his father's administration had problems with Saddam Hussein. He also wanted to get more oil. This is not a good way to start a war.

I think the war has gone on too long. If we leave now, the country might have civil war. Many people will die. The UN and the United States are now trying to get other countries from around Iraq to help. But this might cause more problems. Iraq's independence could be a big issue. The government is not working well. The Prime Minister cannot control the political process. There are many radical groups fighting for power. The political process is very difficult.

I cannot say more about this in polite company.

At this time, I speak about the War in Iraq.
I think it not good because not declared war.
I think it started because we think Iraq do bad things, like nine-eleven.
I no big fan of this war.
I not follow much details.
I think we stay there to help them have democracy.
I think also want oil.
But this no good for many reasons.
We try to change Iraq too much, like make it like U.S.
This no good for Iraq people.
War make Iraq worse and make people angry.
We not say good things about this president.
I think this war like Vietnam and will last forever.
I feel bad for soldiers' families.
But Iraq people and America people different.
If we stay, war will get worse.
Al-Qaeda will grow and hate for U.S. will grow.
I think this war will last many years.
This is end of my thoughts.

I do not feel it is right for the government to make it legal. It is up to the churches to decide. The constitution says separation of church and state. It is already written in stone. I think it is wrong for the government to decide what the churches can and cannot make illegal. Most Catholics and Christians do not support it. It is not up to the government to decide what the churches are allowed to do. Separation of church and state is a key part of the constitution. It is up to the churches to decide this, not the president or any government. There is no reason to make it illegal. It could even be good for society.

I said everything I wanted to say.

I was not happy when the government in my country started a war in Iraq. I thought they did not tell us the real reasons for the war. Many people thought it was related to the attacks of September 11th. But really, the two events did not have much connection. The government made it seem like there was a big danger from Iraq. It wanted us to feel angry about the attacks and support the war. The war started in 2003.

I am against war, especially a preemptive strike. I think we should not get into war. But if we do, we need to plan for all possible outcomes. The government should have been more prepared for the war. Many American soldiers died. The government should have thought about what would happen after removing Iraq's government. The country became unstable and chaotic. The US tried to build a new government, but it was a long and hard process. This was similar to what happened in Vietnam. Many people in Iraq did not support the US. The government did not prepare for the many people who did not want change. Many American soldiers are still dying today. The government is trying to train Iraqi soldiers and police. But it is taking a long time. The government made it seem like the war would be short and successful. But it is not easy to build a new government. It takes time and effort. I think the government did not tell us the truth about the war. The war is still going on today.

I was not sure who to vote for in the 2004 election. I might have voted for George Bush to finish what he started. It is hard to leave Iraq after being there for so long. We took away their government and way of life. But we should also think about the many American soldiers who died. We need to decide if it is worth the risk for a free democratic Iraq. The main reason for the war was oil. We get oil from Iraq. But we did not attack other countries with weapons of mass destruction. I hope the war ends soon, but I do not think it will.

I am for gay marriage. I always have been. I think it is a personal choice, not something that should be controlled by others. I think it is inhumane to take away rights from someone because of something they cannot control. I have been an advocate for gay marriage.

I do not think politics or government should be involved in personal choices. It is a household matter, not a national one. In my neighborhood, there are openly gay couples who live and function like any other family. They walk their dogs and act like any other family.

I think it is ridiculous for politicians to interpret the meaning of marriage. Marriage should be a private choice, not a public issue.

I have read and heard from many sources that being gay might be a biological issue. It could be something you are predisposed to, not something learned from your upbringing.

I think it is strange that marriage between a man and a woman is a private matter, but marriage between two people of the same sex is public news. Marriage should be a private choice, not a public debate.

I do not think it is right for politicians to interfere with personal choices. It is a private matter between two people.

Internet is public, everyone can see.
Putting things online can affect how people think.
If you say bad things, like wanting to hurt others, people will worry.
School must act on these warnings.
School cannot ignore serious threats.
People sometimes joke, but it can be hard to know.
School must check internet accounts.
If something is dangerous, school must act.
School should not follow students online.
School should not make fake accounts to watch students.
Students should not post dangerous things online.
School should not see private things.
School should trust students, but must check when needed.
If something is serious, school must act quickly.

I think the war has gone on too long.
The purpose was good at first.
It was to give democracy to a country.
But now, I think we have lost the reason.
Maybe we are fighting just to show that we are a powerful country.
I think the original reason was not fair.
It involved George Bush’s father and Saddam Hussein.
The purpose of giving democracy to a country is good.
But I think our reason changed and now it is unclear.
We should have ended the war after a few months.
We started the war, and that was enough.
But it went on for years.
The government can now handle their own problems.
They do not need our help anymore.
We spend too much money on this war.
We should use this money to help our own country.
We have many problems here like poverty and schools.
We should not spend money on a long-term war.
We should end the war and use the money to fix our own problems.

I ask question about privacy. Some person found information online. This information helped prevent bad situation.

Other person said this is not invasion of privacy. If put information online, many people can see it. Myspace lets friends see profiles. If accept friend, they get permission to see.

But, it's too difficult for one person to check everyone's profiles. It could be unfair to students. But, if someone finds bad information, this is helpful.

I have Facebook. It makes me worry about people who can see my information. This can be dangerous.

I don't know if school should ban Myspace. It's like telling students what they can't do.

I have to talk about the Iraq War two more times. I feel bad talking about it. I hate to say what everyone else says. I hate to join the people who say, "I was against it from the beginning." I was, but it doesn't matter now. The general idea is that it was a bad idea. Only the administration thinks it was a good idea. Everyone else does not. Eighty percent of people in the world think it was a bad idea. Eighty percent of Iraqis think it was a bad idea. Seventy percent of U.S. troops think it was a bad idea and should leave within the year. It has been a disaster. It started before we went in. Pulling out will be a disaster too. The Middle East is very different from the U.S. You can't just bring democracy to an area where people don't want it. Saddam was bad, but we have to consider the pros and cons. It's like quicksand. I don't know what to say. I don't see a reason to stay. The administration thinks there are good reasons to stay, but I don't agree. If we leave now, we can ask the Iraqis if we should leave. If they say yes, it's not our fault if something happens. If we help later, we can be the good guys. We will never be good guys in the Middle East, but it will be better than staying now.

I think gender discrimination is still a problem in the United States. It affects not only women but also men in different fields. For example, in many jobs, people have a hard time working under a woman because society expects men to be in charge. Women often have the skills to get a job but may not be promoted because of this. Men who stay at home to raise children may face criticism. Society often expects men to be the main money-maker. In the fashion industry, men may not be taken seriously if they are interested in fashion. People might think, "How can a man understand fashion?" Because they think men usually have different styles of life. In different jobs, discrimination can also happen based on where you grew up. For example, if you grew up on a farm and have poor grammar, some people might not take you seriously. I think we are making progress, but it takes time for society to change. We should keep working at a steady pace.

They did not make it legal.
They changed it from a crime to a traffic ticket.
This means, if someone gets caught with it, they get a ticket instead of being arrested.
And this could cause problems for jobs and other things.
But it also costs a lot to arrest and lock up people.
So, some places may legalize it to save money.
In Denver, they did this.
Now they have more money for schools, programs for old people, and food for homeless people.
But people should not smoke it in public.
It is still bad in some places and people do not like it.
Also, alcohol is worse for driving than marijuana.
Both have bad effects, but it depends on the person.
Some people can handle it, and some cannot.
It is hard to know how people will react.
But it should not be everywhere because it is still bad in many places.

I agree.
Many traditions are good.
But, we must also change with time.
Many Catholics go to church every week.
They follow rules very closely.
But, sometimes they do not accept others.
This is not fair.
My parents were from different religions.
The church would not marry them.
This is not good.
The church teaches to love others.
But, they do not accept people of other religions.
This is hypocritical.
I think priests should be allowed to marry.
But, I do not think this will stop bad behavior.
Pedophiles will do bad things, whether they are married or not.
I do not think allowing priests to marry will stop this.

I have not decided about this topic yet.
I cannot say which side is right or wrong. This is the most difficult issue we face today.
The separation of church and state is close. Defining marriage is also difficult.
Marriage is also a sacrament. People do not get tax breaks or special treatment if they are baptized.
So, I think marriage should be a civil union. This is what it is.
Two people are united together. Government should not care about the type of marriage.
They should not ask about religion.
Gay marriage is a civil union.
All states should agree to this. Then they can make it federal law.
A constitutional amendment to ban gay marriage is silly. The constitution should not be changed for this.
This is not big enough to change the constitution.
It is not important enough to amend the constitution to define or ban gay marriage.
Simply, no.

I was raised in a Christian home. Homosexuality is a grey area for me because I have many gay friends. I do not agree with that lifestyle. However, I think it should be legal. It should be a decision made by each state, not the president. Many states are democratic and many are republican. Democratic states will support gay marriage. If you live in a democratic state, you know how it feels about this issue. Each state should decide on gay marriage. I think homosexuals should have the same opportunities as heterosexuals. I disagree with Bush's ban on gay marriage. He should not decide this for the whole country. He should not decide how each state wants to run itself. I think some things should be left up to each state. Plus, he will be out of office in a few years. If a democratic president wants to lift the ban, it will just go back and forth. It should be up to each state because they will live with the decision. I do not agree with Bush's decision.

Myspace is a public place. People post there for others to see. If something is posted on the internet, school officials can see it. This is okay because it helps them keep students safe.

If school officials use Myspace to catch students in trouble, that is an invasion of privacy. But, if they do this to make the school safer, it is fine. For example, they might look for students who post about drinking or smoking. This helps keep students safe.

I am worried about posting things online. I am afraid something bad will happen later in life. For example, I might write a bad email about someone and it might come back to haunt me.

Schools must keep students safe. They do this by practicing for emergencies like terrorist attacks. They also use Myspace to help keep students safe. This is what school officials were doing in this case. They were making the school safer.

I was very angry after nine eleven.
I wanted to go to Iraq and fight there.
I thought we could cause as much trouble as they had caused in America.
Now, I think this was not a good idea.
We were not prepared.
We did not have a plan.
I think it did not help our situation.
I do not think people in Iraq are good.
They fight a lot.
They cannot work together.
I do not think we should stay there.
We should leave.
I think we went there because we were very angry.
Now I think we should leave.
We cannot change people there.
We should not try to make them better.
I think we should just leave.
We are not helping there.
We are just hurting ourselves.

I think the Catholic Church needs to change some things.
Many people leave because the Church does not accept many things. These include same-sex marriage, abortion, and birth control.
The Church has strong views. But some of these views are old. They should change to a newer style.
People are leaving the Church because they do not agree with these views.
I think women could be priests and priests could be married.
I do not know if these changes would make people stay.
But I think priests should have a family life like other people.

I like people. I do not mind if they are gay. Why should they be blamed for their feelings? I think everyone has a right to love who they want. It is not a choice they make. I am not against gay marriage. I think it is wrong to say that a man and a woman can marry, but two people of the same sex cannot. I do not think the government should be involved in this. It is not about security or morals. They should not tell people how to live their lives. People are born that way. They should not be punished for it. I believe in freedom.

I believe that gay marriage should be legal. Many people think that gay couples threaten traditional families. However, gay relationships are different than straight relationships. They are not the same, like two sides of a coin: heads and tails. Many people have different opinions about morality and religion. Legalizing gay marriage does not mean gay couples want to get married in a church. They just want a legal document, like a marriage certificate. This does not involve church and state. Some people say that gay couples cannot adopt children or that they will harm society. However, scientific studies show that gay couples have the same success rates as straight couples. Other people think that gay couples will cause problems in communities or that their children will be harmed. However, studies show that children of gay parents do well in society. The federal government should make gay marriage legal in every state. President Bush has strong views about gay marriage, similar to his views on abortion and stem cell research. Most reasons against gay marriage are based on religion. However, what is right morally can differ from person to person. It is unethical to ignore the moral beliefs of other groups while supporting laws based on religious beliefs. Many people believe that gay people are psychologically damaged. However, the American Psychological Association says this is not true. People should listen to experts and studies, not just popular opinions.

I work at a hospital pharmacy over the summer.
Just because a drug is illegal does not mean it is good for people.
I would not give it to the public.
But for medical use, yes.
Many illegal drugs are good. Like oxycodone, Vicodin, Percocet.
These are called controlled substances.
We use them because they help people. If you say no to marijuana because it is illegal, you should not.
You should think about the good things it does.
It is not like alcohol. If you do not abuse it, it is not harmful.
I think it should become legal gradually, not all at once, because then people will abuse it.
First, we must change how people think about marijuana.
If we do that, people will use it responsibly.
They can use it for medical reasons too.

I think the church has changed for the 21st century.
It is less strict than before.
When I was young, I went to church every Sunday.
I wore cute dresses, matching shoes, and a purse.
I went to a private school and saw friends there on weekends.
Now, the church has a special mass for teens.
It is 30 minutes long and people dress casually.
During summer, some people come straight from the beach.
There are late families too.
So, the church is more casual.
Even at morning masses, people wear jeans and khakis.
The church politics and priest marries are not clear.
I do not think they could have prevented the pedophile accusations.
Some men who are married still become pedophiles.
I think it is genetics, not their choice.
Marriage does not change this.
Some religions allow priests to marry, like Seventh Heaven.
If they want to marry, they might change religions.
The church could not stop pedophiles if they did not know.
Shame on them if they covered it up.

I was okay with starting the Iraq war, but I think we went in under a false reason. Many people believe that the Bush administration used the September 11th attacks and Osama Bin Laden as a reason to go to war with Iraq. They said Saddam Hussein had weapons of mass destruction, but that was not true.

I think the Bush administration lied to the American people. Even Colin Powell, who presented evidence at the UN, now says he did not believe it. I think that is a serious crime. It is like the Bush administration did not care about the constitution. They wanted to go to war.

I think the younger Bush wanted to go to war because his father's administration had problems with Saddam Hussein. He also wanted to get more oil. This is not a good way to start a war.

I think the war has gone on too long. If we leave now, the country might have civil war. Many people will die. The UN and the United States are now trying to get other countries from around Iraq to help. But this might cause more problems. Iraq's independence could be a big issue. The government is not working well. The Prime Minister cannot control the political process. There are many radical groups fighting for power. The political process is very difficult.

I cannot say more about this in polite company.

At this time, I speak about the War in Iraq.
I think it not good because not declared war.
I think it started because we think Iraq do bad things, like nine-eleven.
I no big fan of this war.
I not follow much details.
I think we stay there to help them have democracy.
I think also want oil.
But this no good for many reasons.
We try to change Iraq too much, like make it like U.S.
This no good for Iraq people.
War make Iraq worse and make people angry.
We not say good things about this president.
I think this war like Vietnam and will last forever.
I feel bad for soldiers' families.
But Iraq people and America people different.
If we stay, war will get worse.
Al-Qaeda will grow and hate for U.S. will grow.
I think this war will last many years.
This is end of my thoughts.

I do not feel it is right for the government to make it legal. It is up to the churches to decide. The constitution says separation of church and state. It is already written in stone. I think it is wrong for the government to decide what the churches can and cannot make illegal. Most Catholics and Christians do not support it. It is not up to the government to decide what the churches are allowed to do. Separation of church and state is a key part of the constitution. It is up to the churches to decide this, not the president or any government. There is no reason to make it illegal. It could even be good for society.

I said everything I wanted to say.

I was not happy when the government in my country started a war in Iraq. I thought they did not tell us the real reasons for the war. Many people thought it was related to the attacks of September 11th. But really, the two events did not have much connection. The government made it seem like there was a big danger from Iraq. It wanted us to feel angry about the attacks and support the war. The war started in 2003.

I am against war, especially a preemptive strike. I think we should not get into war. But if we do, we need to plan for all possible outcomes. The government should have been more prepared for the war. Many American soldiers died. The government should have thought about what would happen after removing Iraq's government. The country became unstable and chaotic. The US tried to build a new government, but it was a long and hard process. This was similar to what happened in Vietnam. Many people in Iraq did not support the US. The government did not prepare for the many people who did not want change. Many American soldiers are still dying today. The government is trying to train Iraqi soldiers and police. But it is taking a long time. The government made it seem like the war would be short and successful. But it is not easy to build a new government. It takes time and effort. I think the government did not tell us the truth about the war. The war is still going on today.

I was not sure who to vote for in the 2004 election. I might have voted for George Bush to finish what he started. It is hard to leave Iraq after being there for so long. We took away their government and way of life. But we should also think about the many American soldiers who died. We need to decide if it is worth the risk for a free democratic Iraq. The main reason for the war was oil. We get oil from Iraq. But we did not attack other countries with weapons of mass destruction. I hope the war ends soon, but I do not think it will.

I am for gay marriage. I always have been. I think it is a personal choice, not something that should be controlled by others. I think it is inhumane to take away rights from someone because of something they cannot control. I have been an advocate for gay marriage.

I do not think politics or government should be involved in personal choices. It is a household matter, not a national one. In my neighborhood, there are openly gay couples who live and function like any other family. They walk their dogs and act like any other family.

I think it is ridiculous for politicians to interpret the meaning of marriage. Marriage should be a private choice, not a public issue.

I have read and heard from many sources that being gay might be a biological issue. It could be something you are predisposed to, not something learned from your upbringing.

I think it is strange that marriage between a man and a woman is a private matter, but marriage between two people of the same sex is public news. Marriage should be a private choice, not a public debate.

I do not think it is right for politicians to interfere with personal choices. It is a private matter between two people.

If something is serious, school must act quickly.

I think the war has gone on too long.
The purpose was good at first.
It was to give democracy to a country.
But now, I think we have lost the reason.
Maybe we are fighting just to show that we are a powerful country.
I think the original reason was not fair.
It involved George Bush’s father and Saddam Hussein.
The purpose of giving democracy to a country is good.
But I think our reason changed and now it is unclear.
We should have ended the war after a few months.
We started the war, and that was enough.
But it went on for years.
The government can now handle their own problems.
They do not need our help anymore.
We spend too much money on this war.
We should use this money to help our own country.
We have many problems here like poverty and schools.
We should not spend money on a long-term war.
We should end the war and use the money to fix our own problems.

I ask question about privacy. Some person found information online. This information helped prevent bad situation.

Other person said this is not invasion of privacy. If put information online, many people can see it. Myspace lets friends see profiles. If accept friend, they get permission to see.

But, it's too difficult for one person to check everyone's profiles. It could be unfair to students. But, if someone finds bad information, this is helpful.

I have Facebook. It makes me worry about people who can see my information. This can be dangerous.

I don't know if school should ban Myspace. It's like telling students what they can't do.

I have to talk about the Iraq War two more times. I feel bad talking about it. I hate to say what everyone else says. I hate to join the people who say, "I was against it from the beginning." I was, but it doesn't matter now. The general idea is that it was a bad idea. Only the administration thinks it was a good idea. Everyone else does not. Eighty percent of people in the world think it was a bad idea. Eighty percent of Iraqis think it was a bad idea. Seventy percent of U.S. troops think it was a bad idea and should leave within the year. It has been a disaster. It started before we went in. Pulling out will be a disaster too. The Middle East is very different from the U.S. You can't just bring democracy to an area where people don't want it. Saddam was bad, but we have to consider the pros and cons. It's like quicksand. I don't know what to say. I don't see a reason to stay. The administration thinks there are good reasons to stay, but I don't agree. If we leave now, we can ask the Iraqis if we should leave. If they say yes, it's not our fault if something happens. If we help later, we can be the good guys. We will never be good guys in the Middle East, but it will be better than staying now.

I think gender discrimination is still a problem in the United States. It affects not only women but also men in different fields. For example, in many jobs, people have a hard time working under a woman because society expects men to be in charge. Women often have the skills to get a job but may not be promoted because of this. Men who stay at home to raise children may face criticism. Society often expects men to be the main money-maker. In the fashion industry, men may not be taken seriously if they are interested in fashion. People might think, "How can a man understand fashion?" Because they think men usually have different styles of life. In different jobs, discrimination can also happen based on where you grew up. For example, if you grew up on a farm and have poor grammar, some people might not take you seriously. I think we are making progress, but it takes time for society to change. We should keep working at a steady pace.

They did not make it legal.
They changed it from a crime to a traffic ticket.
This means, if someone gets caught with it, they get a ticket instead of being arrested.
And this could cause problems for jobs and other things.
But it also costs a lot to arrest and lock up people.
So, some places may legalize it to save money.
In Denver, they did this.
Now they have more money for schools, programs for old people, and food for homeless people.
But people should not smoke it in public.
It is still bad in some places and people do not like it.
Also, alcohol is worse for driving than marijuana.
Both have bad effects, but it depends on the person.
Some people can handle it, and some cannot.
It is hard to know how people will react.
But it should not be everywhere because it is still bad in many places.

I agree.
Many traditions are good.
But, we must also change with time.
Many Catholics go to church every week.
They follow rules very closely.
But, sometimes they do not accept others.
This is not fair.
My parents were from different religions.
The church would not marry them.
This is not good.
The church teaches to love others.
But, they do not accept people of other religions.
This is hypocritical.
I think priests should be allowed to marry.
But, I do not think this will stop bad behavior.
Pedophiles will do bad things, whether they are married or not.
I do not think allowing priests to marry will stop this.

I have not decided about this topic yet.
I cannot say which side is right or wrong. This is the most difficult issue we face today.
The separation of church and state is close. Defining marriage is also difficult.
Marriage is also a sacrament. People do not get tax breaks or special treatment if they are baptized.
So, I think marriage should be a civil union. This is what it is.
Two people are united together. Government should not care about the type of marriage.
They should not ask about religion.
Gay marriage is a civil union.
All states should agree to this. Then they can make it federal law.
A constitutional amendment to ban gay marriage is silly. The constitution should not be changed for this.
This is not big enough to change the constitution.
It is not important enough to amend the constitution to define or ban gay marriage.
Simply, no.

I was raised in a Christian home. Homosexuality is a grey area for me because I have many gay friends. I do not agree with that lifestyle. However, I think it should be legal. It should be a decision made by each state, not the president. Many states are democratic and many are republican. Democratic states will support gay marriage. If you live in a democratic state, you know how it feels about this issue. Each state should decide on gay marriage. I think homosexuals should have the same opportunities as heterosexuals. I disagree with Bush's ban on gay marriage. He should not decide this for the whole country. He should not decide how each state wants to run itself. I think some things should be left up to each state. Plus, he will be out of office in a few years. If a democratic president wants to lift the ban, it will just go back and forth. It should be up to each state because they will live with the decision. I do not agree with Bush's decision.

Myspace is a public place. People post there for others to see. If something is posted on the internet, school officials can see it. This is okay because it helps them keep students safe.

If school officials use Myspace to catch students in trouble, that is an invasion of privacy. But, if they do this to make the school safer, it is fine. For example, they might look for students who post about drinking or smoking. This helps keep students safe.

I am worried about posting things online. I am afraid something bad will happen later in life. For example, I might write a bad email about someone and it might come back to haunt me.

Schools must keep students safe. They do this by practicing for emergencies like terrorist attacks. They also use Myspace to help keep students safe. This is what school officials were doing in this case. They were making the school safer.
